summary: In 2018, the President imposed tariffs on many steel and aluminum imports, and told the Department of Commerce to allow companies to request relief from paying these tariffs in certain circumstances. Commerce rejected thousands of these "tariff exclusion requests" because companies made errors in their applications. It also did not decide most of the requests within its established deadlines, which created a backlog of almost...
title: Steel and Aluminum Tariffs: Commerce Should Improve Its Exclusion Request Process and Economic Impact Reviews
